abstract.p: Consumer Product Safety Commission announces recall of almost three million swings, walkers and bassinets that pose serious hazards; says parents should stop using products, which are made by Fisher-Price and Kids Line (S)

block.p: Almost three million swings, walkers and bassinets are being recalled because they pose serious hazards, the Consumer Product Safety Commission said today. The agency said parents should stop using them at once.

The products under recall are about 2.5 million Lift 'n Lock Swings and about 246,000 Get Up & Go Walkers, both made by Fisher-Price of East Aurora, N.Y., a subsidiary of Mattel, and about 46,000 Le Cradle bassinets, manufactured by Kids Line of Los Angeles.

Almost three million swings, walkers and bassinets are being recalled because they pose serious hazards, the Consumer Product Safety Commission said today. The agency said parents should stop using them at once.

The products under recall are about 2.5 million Lift 'n Lock Swings and about 246,000 Get Up & Go Walkers, both made by Fisher-Price of East Aurora, N.Y., a subsidiary of Mattel, and about 46,000 Le Cradle bassinets, manufactured by Kids Line of Los Angeles.

Fisher-Price will provide free repair kits for the swings and walkers. Information is available on its Web site (www.fisher-price.com) and on the commission's Web site (www.cpsc.gov). For information on the bassinets, call (800) 638-2772.
